benchmark_details.name: MSDiagnosis (Multi-Step Clinical Diagnosis Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: MSDiagnosis is a benchmark for evaluating large language models in multi-step clinical diagnosis, consisting of 2,225 cases that cover tasks such as primary diagnosis, differential diagnosis, and final diagnosis.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate multi-step diagnostic abilities of large language models in alignment with clinical practice.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Due to limited data sources, the dataset exhibits an uneven distribution across different departments.

data.annotation: Manual annotation by a professional medical team

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the comparison between generated diagnoses and reference diagnoses in the dataset.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better alignment with the clinical diagnosis tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Ours: F1 of 38.76% for Left clavicle fracture and other metrics as per results in Table 3.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data was anonymized and no protected health information is present.
